result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon J. Naniot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge + DV surcharge = $648.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription. 
No entry into any bars, taverns or restaurants that serve alcohol.
No violent or unnecessary contact with victim.

All contact with child's mother must be done through Our Family Wizard and Deft to pay the full cost for the App.
Must follow all existing court orders for placement.
Anger Management evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-25-2022.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time.
With Huber release.
Concurrent with: To conditional jail in 22CM5

Court calls cases 22CM2 and 22CM5.
Atty Lyon heard - cases have been resolved.
Atty Lyon has plea forms completed.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Lyon agrees.
DA reads charge and reviews maximum penalties.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CM5.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 of 22CM2.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court advises of possible federal firearm restrictions due to the domestic violations.
Deft understands.
Victim rights compliance.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty Lyon satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 of 22CM5 and Count 2 of 22CM2.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 22CM5 and Count 1 of 22CM2.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Lyon heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 22CM5:
9 months jail, and places Deft on probation for 18 months.
Conditions of probation:
30 days conditional jail, without good time, but with huber release.
Credit for 3 days time served.
Deft to report to the Marinette County Jail no later than 7 pm on 10-25-2022.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge = $658.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or restaurants that serve alcohol.
No violent or unnecessary contact with Victim.
All contact with child's mother must be done through Our Family Wizard and Deft to pay the full cost for the App.
Must follow all existing court orders for placement.
Maintain full time employment.
Anger Management evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-25-2022.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2 of 22CM2:
90 days jail, consecutive to 22CM5, and places Deft on probation for 18 months.
Conditions of probation:
30 days conditional jail, concurrent to the conditional jail in 22CM5, without good time, but with huber release.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge = $648.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
